meanings.definition: The act of selecting or appointing someone to a position or role
meanings.sent1: The cooption of new members into the team was done carefully.
meanings.sent2: The cooption of the candidate for the leadership role was well received.
meanings.sent3: The cooption of the cat as the new office manager raised some eyebrows.
meanings.sent4: The cooption of fresh ideas into the project breathed new life into it.
meanings.sent5: The cooption of talented individuals into the organization was a strategic move.

meanings.definition: The process of absorbing or assimilating something into a larger group or system
meanings.sent1: The cooption of different cultures into the community enriched its diversity.
meanings.sent2: The cooption of the new technology into the existing system was seamless.
meanings.sent3: The cooption of the stray dog into the family brought unexpected joy.
meanings.sent4: The cooption of innovative practices into the business model revolutionized operations.
meanings.sent5: The cooption of fresh perspectives into the discussion sparked insightful conversations.
